contentrichtext.text: '''SDL''' may refer to: ==Computing== * [[Simple Declarative Language]], a simple universal language for describing typed data in lists, maps and trees * [[Specification and Description Language]], an ITU-specified system description language * [[Security Development Lifecycle]], a software development process by [[Microsoft]] * [[Simple DirectMedia Layer]], a cross-platform, free and open source multimedia library * [[Services Description Language]], a specification language developed at Microsoft as a successor of CORBA's IDL; a fore-runner to [[Web Services Description Language]] * [[Structure Definition Language]], a data definition language for [[OpenVMS]] * Scene Description Language, the language used by [[POV-Ray]] ==Organizations== * [[Party of the Democratic Left (Slovakia)]], a former political party of Slovakia (1990–2004) * [[Party of the Democratic Left (2005)]], a centre-left political party in Slovakia founded 2005 * [[Scottish Defence League]], a far-right anti-Muslim street protest organisation in Scotland * [[Social Democratic League of America]] (1917-1920), an American propaganda organization * [[Soqosoqo Duavata ni Lewenivanua]], a political party in Fiji * [[Space Dynamics Laboratory]], at Utah State University * [[SDL International]], a British company selling translation tools and services *: [[SDL Tridion]], a web content management system ==Other uses== * [[Schematic driven layout]], a concept in the design of integrated circuits * [[SDL connector]], an electrical signal connector * [[Sexual division of labour]] * [[Sundsvall-Härnösand Airport]], IATA airport code * [[Scottsdale Airport]], FAA airport code * [[Service dominant logic (marketing)]], A marketing logic in business stating the need for migration from goods marketing to services marketing. * [[Super-imposed Dead Load (Structural Engineering)]], Any applied load other than dead load. Usually means a load that is in addition to the dead weight of the bar joists and bridging. {{disambiguation}}
